author: ralexstokes
content: i think we need to be specific about various attacks

author: ralexstokes
content: somethings are not attributable and that information can be derived by the relay monitor and passed to mev-boost, which must then decide what to do w/ the information

author: sky.cactus
content: I meant generally are you deriving all of your data from trustless sources, or are you asking the relay to tell you things and trusting it isn't lying?

author: ralexstokes
content: ah the former

author: ralexstokes
content: the relay APIs are great but i don't think we can rely on them for security purposes

author: ralexstokes
content: so instead, the relay monitor looks at any data it gets via public APIs from relays and (for those mev-boost users who opt-in) can get signed auction "transcripts"

author: ralexstokes
content: all of this data can be correlated with data on-chain to get a good idea of what is happening

author: ralexstokes
content: there is still some stuff where it is hard to say who is at fault, but the fault can be surfaced and then we can add increasingly sophisticated policy logic to mev-boost over time to figure out how to deal with it

author: sky.cactus
content: Anything that surfaces inconsistencies would make me happier than the current situation.
